meanings.definition: Waste away or diminish in size or strength
meanings.sent1: Without exercise, the muscle atrophies and becomes weaker.
meanings.sent2: If you don't use it, your brain atrophies over time.
meanings.sent3: The neglected plant atrophies sadly in the dark corner.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence atrophies like a flower without sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting your skills is like letting them atrophies into nothingness.

meanings.sent1: After the injury, his leg muscles atrophied and became smaller.
meanings.sent2: As we age, our bones may atrophy and become more fragile.
meanings.sent3: The abandoned building atrophies, slowly crumbling to dust.
meanings.sent4: His dreams atrophied like old paper left out in the rain.
meanings.sent5: Neglect can cause relationships to atrophies and fade away.

meanings.definition: Gradually decline in effectiveness or vigor
meanings.sent1: Without proper care, the organization atrophies and loses its impact.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the once vibrant colors of the painting atrophied.
meanings.sent3: The team's spirit atrophies when they stop supporting each other.
meanings.sent4: Neglecting your goals allows them to atrophies into mere wishes.
meanings.sent5: The lack of motivation can cause skills to atrophies and stagnate.
